thread.section_title: Stock Market & Finance News - Wall Street Journal
thread.title: Bank of America Earnings Hurt by Tax-Related Charge

author: Rachel Louise Ensign
title: Bank of America Earnings Hurt by Tax-Related Charge

organizations.name: tax-related charge bank of america corp.

text:
Bank of America Corp. said Wednesday that its fourth-quarter profit fell from a year ago, hurt by a $2.9 billion charge related to the tax bill, even as the bank ended a year that put its crisis-era issues firmly in the past.
The Charlotte, N.C.-based bank reported a profit of $2.37 billion, or 20 cents a share. Without the tax charge, the bank’s profit was $5.3 billion, or 47 cents a share. Analysts polled by Thomson Reuters had expected earnings of 44 cents a share, on an adjusted basis.
... RELATED VIDEO A Brief History of Retail Banking The retail banking industry is undergoing another major shift, and the future looks high-tech, sophisticated, and, for big banks, very urban. So what has changed? Photo: Shaumbé Wright/The Wall Street Journal
